title: Update Item Shop

embed.description: League of Legends Champion Builder. Unique and robust tools to help you theorize Champion Builds.

body:
Why is it a website can include things like Magic Penetration and Armor Penetration in its builder, yet a professional gaming company do not include these in the shop?

Is RIOT afraid of a little penetration?  Seriously though, when I started playing this game I found myself sitting in base scrolling through the items trying to find the counters to Armor and Magic Resist for 2-3 minutes sometimes. 
This STILL needs to be added.

replies.body:
Unfortunately, we have to be careful with the checkbox menu in game. For most players (especially when concerning lower resolutions) it becomes less and less efficient to use the more categories there are. Already it's tipping over usability a bit.

These searches are already tagged though to be searchable. We just haven't hooked a checkbox to them.
You **can** use the search menu and look for "Magic Penetration" or "Armor Penetration" (or whatever other shortcut).
Can we get the shop updated so that we can search "on-hit" to find items like BotRK, Wit's End, Nashor's Tooth etc?
What? But I tried it. I tried it *this patch.* It didn't work. I don't remember who I was using, but it didn't work.
What if we were able to edit the shop to how we like it? Like the tags and such. We could remove some and add some?

One idea I had was that you can re-purpose the custom item build to add a page for armor/magic penetration (not specifically Riot, but users) and include a list of all the items that include those stats, then list them for all characters on all maps?

> Is RIOT afraid of a **little penetration? **

Go big or go home.
^ u can also type in MR or MP  or any other abbreviation there is, (bork, ie, bt...)
